title: Imported settings
content: Hi, I recently installed firefox, and I accidentally imported my chrome things a thing that I didn't want, how can I cancel this?
creator: Nevobloch

title: copy (MAC) container associations to another machine
content:
I have most of Firefox on a new (Windows 10) machine just like it was on my old one, and it works and feels nearly alike. But I can't find where sites are associated with their containers. I would like to copy the file(s) where these are stored to my profile on the new machine. But which file(s)?

Thanks for your help!
creator: ffoxsynch

title: How Do I stop Firefox from Resolving www.facebook.com
content:
I have put blockers in place (Layer 7 Firewall Rules, DNS dummy zones, etc.) yet facebook.com is still accessible from my Mozilla Firefox browser. How do I tell Firefox to use DNS like it's supposed to instead of some secret back-door into this Social Marketing rubbish? Microsoft Edge works just fine. I've not tried nor do I intend to use Google Chrome so that browser is not an issue. Just Firefox.

Is there some cache I need to clear in the infinite number of inane Firefox settings.

I would like to keep using Firefox if I can just tell it to do what I tell it. Uninstalling Firefox is killing a fly with a sledgehammer; and I don't want to do that.

Please help.
creator: randyf62003

title: Crash on a plugin won't let me submit crash report
content: I have a plugin that says its crashed it's the WidevineCdm plugin. I have tried submitting a crash report but it won't let me. I tried resetting the browser, re-downloading the browser nothing seems to help. What do I do?
creator: elise33227

title: There are some bookmarks listed under the "manage account" tab.
content: I don't know how they got there, and I cannot get rid of them. If you could show me how, it would be much appreciated. Thanks.
creator: convallaria08

title: firefox on new apple operating systems
content: I am wanting to upgrade my old mac mini to the new version with the M01 chip. Can I bring Firefox and all my extensions to Big Sur on Apple?
creator: southranch

title: Cannot access *.localhost
content:
Since Firefox 89 (maybe one or two releases before) *.localhost sites are not accessible, but those sites are available through other browsers or tools (Postman, Chrome, and Edge). Localhost is an Nginx server mounted on WSL2, so itâ€™s IP does not correspond to 127.0.0.1 which is what Firefox thinks (about:networking#dnslookuptool).

There is no Proxy enabled. I also deleted the site settings on Firefox, disabled IPv6 and prefetch with no result.
creator: choncho

title: Two-level tabs stack
content:
Hi,

Sorry if I ask in the wrong place. Vivaldi browser has great two-level tabs stack feature. Do you know if firefox developers plan to introduce this in firefox? I don't ask about addons but a native feature built-in firefox.
creator: james.jacques.diego
